question: In humans, does alirocumab treatment reduce the fractional clearance rate of apolipoprotein(a) compared with placebo? Answer with Yes or No.

content.source_1: The FCR of apo(a) tended to increase (24.6%) without any change in apo(a) PR.
content.source_2: Conclusions: Alirocumab decreased LDL-C and plasma Lp(a) in part by lowering the fractional clearance rate of apo(a), indicating diminished catabolic removal of Lp(a).
content.source_3: The increase in apo(a) FCR during alirocumab treatment suggests that increased LDL receptors may also play a role in the reduction of plasma Lp(a).
content.source_4: In a tracer-kinetic study of healthy volunteers, alirocumab was associated with increased IDL/LDL apoB clearance but a reduced apo(a) fractional clearance rate versus baseline over a 4-week dosing interval, with no change in apo(a) production.
